intro: Machaerina restioides subsp. effusa, commonly known as the slender machaerina, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, preferring well-drained soils. It is often found in association with other native flora in the region's coastal ecosystems. The subspecies effusa is distinguished by its more slender growth habit compared to other subspecies of Machaerina.
